item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 28th November
item.description:
he drains have been jetted within and beyond the domestic property and are clear, however a continued unresolved problem on the main section under the public road causes them to back up: The attached photographs show their state on 23 and 25 November respectively. These were days of slight rain either side of a day or heavy rain; even before that heavy rain the water seen within the inspection cover on 4 cowlsmead is standing above the level of the pipework - it is not able to clear due to blockage downstream, within the pipework that is your responsibility. Due to that issue, when rain was heavier on 24 November damage was caused inside homes due to flooding. Please can this be urgently addressed? This issue has been raised previously but not fixed.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 28th November

item.title: Dangerous and Illegal Parking, 28th November
item.description:
The location of the dangerous and illegal parking is in The Highgrove, between the junction of Charlecote Corner and Voxwell Lane. At school pick-up times (0800-0840 and 1445-1545), cars park all along the one side of the road between Charlecote corner and Voxwell lane, blocking the entire side of the road, with some cars also parking within 10m of both the junction of the Highgrove with Charlecote Corner and Voxwell Lane. This causes a very dangerous hazard, as the only way to exit the Highgrove is to drive on the wrong side of the road, right up to the junction hoping that nothing come round the corner. There have been lots of very near misses and ant least one accident because of this parking. This parking also causes a serious hazard for any emergency vehicles needing access to the Highgrove. It also blocks local residents from using the drop curbs to exit/enter their own driveways. The school has kindly asked people that collect children from Grangefield to park considerately in the local area, but the problem continues. There is a very real risk that a serious accident will occur soon if action is not taken. Can I suggest painting a white line along this area, with “no parking” written in paint on the road, just like the markings used in Stoke road and the junction with Cheltenham Rd?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, The Highgrove, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights continuously cycle through red-green in absence of pedestrians, Ermin Street near Vicarage Lane, 28th November
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing outside Vicarage Court, on Ermin Street between Vicarage Lane and Green Street is showing that a pedestrian has requested to cross at all times. The pedestrian request button illuminates as soon as the traffic lights return to green. As far as I know, this is a new issue today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
